item.title: Panel Data article
item.description: What is Panel Data # Panel Data has two dimensions: Longitudinal: observasions cross sections (locations, sites, etc) Short: observasions across time. Sometimes panel data are also refered as logitudinal data, pooled data, cross-sectional time-series data.

item.title: Panel Data Analysis Example
item.description: Import data # Load data # load("df.Rdata") df_panel <- df %>% select(sitedir, date, avc_speed_weighted, avc_volume, radar_volume, radar_speed_weighted, inrix_speed_mean, here_speed_mean) colnames(df_panel) <- c("sitedir", "date", "avc_speed", "avc_volume", "radar_volume", "radar_speed", "inrix_speed", "here_speed") head(df_panel) ## sitedir date avc_speed avc_volume radar_volume radar_speed ## 1 811003_EB 2021-09-01 48.64577 19728 19601 48.53849 ## 2 811003_EB 2021-09-02 49.26103 19964 19813 49.03422 ## 3 811003_EB 2021-09-03 49.64343 21078 20931 49.49420 ## 4 811003_EB 2021-09-04 51.42129 16935 16879 51.

item.title: Panel Data Analysis Example
item.description: Import data # Load data # load("df.Rdata") df_panel <- df %>% select(sitedir, date, avc_speed_weighted, avc_volume, radar_volume, radar_speed_weighted, inrix_speed_mean, here_speed_mean) colnames(df_panel) <- c("sitedir", "date", "avc_speed", "avc_volume", "radar_volume", "radar_speed", "inrix_speed", "here_speed") head(df_panel) ## sitedir date avc_speed avc_volume radar_volume radar_speed ## 1 811003_EB 2021-09-01 48.64577 19728 19601 48.53849 ## 2 811003_EB 2021-09-02 49.26103 19964 19813 49.03422 ## 3 811003_EB 2021-09-03 49.64343 21078 20931 49.49420 ## 4 811003_EB 2021-09-04 51.42129 16935 16879 51.

item.title: MyRpost
item.description: Heading 1 # Heading 2 # Some text here library(ggplot2) x = seq(-1, 1, .01) y = sin(x^3)/(1 + x^6) ggplot(mapping = aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_line() + geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = 0, ymax = y), fill = "pink", alpha = 0.5) + theme_void()

item.title: Panel Data Analysis222
item.description: What is Panel Data # Panel Data has two dimensions: Longitudinal: observasions cross sections (locations, sites, etc) Short: observasions across time. Sometimes panel data are also refered as logitudinal data, pooled data, cross-sectional time-series data. But for files not named as _index.md. It cannot refer to images at the same folder Yes, if you add an image not in the index file, it’s wrong

How to update content
item.description: Create # Create new content for your site: npm run create [path] [flags] See also the Hugo docs: hugo new. Docs based tree # Create a docs based tree â€” with a single command: npm run create -- --kind docs [section] For example, create a docs based tree named learn: npm run create -- --kind docs learn The command for creating docs sections under existing “learn” folder
